message: just an idea that comes through my mind. I have no idea how much flexibility browsers give inside their extension api to modifiy the behaviour of their searchboxes

but if we could extend their functionnality with kynetx in a standard way ( one code for all browsers) we could  create some cool meta search engines that run inside the browser. Something I have always dreamt of.

A very powerful idea to be able to provide search results for Google, Twitter, FB, Wikipedia, etc ... but since the browser search box is browser specific we will need for the KBX to provide the hooks. I don't believe it is a userland feature
I have got an email out to the greplin team... so that I can build their functionality into a KBX app. Other than that, I agree with Ed... not sure it is possible.
by the way, when will KBX run on IE?
on chromium there is this : http://dev.chromium.org/searchbox . interesting I think. Maybe it makes it possible to control apps inside the "omnibox "
I think it will be possible for FF, but getting the same behavior in IE is going to be tough. We do want to keep as much browser parity as we can, but will go beyond that when it really is worth it.
It's going to be at least a couple of months
and of course the next logical step would be to control a kynetx app with.... kinect : http://gizmodo.com/#!5798487/how-to-hack-your-kinect
What we need is a Kinect interface that runs a Kynetx App to control a Kynex robot.
